title: Autobiography of Samuel Smiles ...
author: Smiles, Samuel
snippet: Down the valley of the Tyne, towards the east, the landscape extends over Amisfield, Whittinghame, towards Hailes Castle, where the ill-fated Queen Mary took temporary refuge with her third husband, after spending the night at Bothwell House, Haddington. Waprain Law shuts out part of the view to the east.
